submissions.name: Inaugural language
submissions.creator: The Boston Globe
submissions.description: "American inaugural addresses often cover similar ground. They celebrate American values while looking forward to the future, but the vocabulary has changed over the decades.... The following graphs visualize inaugural addresses words. Each dot represents one word. Darker dots indicate more frequent usage. The graph radius represents duration of speech. Common English words have been removed."

submissions.name: School Segregation after Brown
submissions.creator: Propublica
submissions.description:
"
   Hundreds of school districts were placed under court order to desegregate following the Supreme Courtâ€™s 1954 Brown v. Board of Education ruling. Many communities do not know the status of these orders. Use this tool to find out whether your district is or ever was under a desegregation order, and also to look at the levels of integration and segregation in your schools. "

submissions.name: July US jobs report

submissions.description: A dashboard of US employment figures that updates as soon as new statistics are released
